name: Mnemonic Realms v2.0 — Game Bible
description: Author the complete game bible as markdown documentation. Every location, character, quest, item, enemy, and system fully specified. No code — pure content.

userStories.title: Author detailed geography document with zone specs
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need a complete geography document specifying every zone in the game world with tile-level detail, so map designers know exactly what to build.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/world/geography.md created
Defines 5+ distinct zones: Village Hub, Settled Lands, Frontier, The Sketch, The Depths
Each zone has: size (tile dimensions), biome type, dominant tileset, key landmarks, connections to other zones
Village Hub specifies building positions: shop, elder's house, quest board, inn, training ground
Frontier specifies vibrancy transition gradients
The Sketch specifies abstract/unfinished tile aesthetics
Cross-references docs/world/setting.md for consistency
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: SEQUENTIAL — must complete before map docs (US-015+). Read docs/world/setting.md for context. The world is young and unfinished, not dying.

userStories.title: Author per-zone vibrancy system specification
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need the vibrancy mechanic fully specified so implementers know exactly how broadcasting memories changes zone visuals and gameplay.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/world/vibrancy-system.md created
Defines vibrancy scale: 0-100 per zone
Three visual tiers: Muted (0-33), Normal (34-66), Vivid (67-100)
Specifies exactly which tiles swap at each threshold for each biome type
Defines how broadcasting a memory fragment changes vibrancy (formula or table)
Defines vibrancy decay (if any) and Preserver reinforcement mechanics
Specifies global ambient effects (sky color, particle density) as average of visited zones
Audio layer changes per vibrancy tier documented
Cross-references docs/design/memory-system.md
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: PARALLEL with US-001. Read docs/design/memory-system.md and docs/design/visual-direction.md for context.

userStories.title: Author dormant gods document with all recall options
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need all four dormant gods fully specified with their recall options and world-state effects.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/world/dormant-gods.md created
Four gods defined: Resonance (sound), Verdance (growth), Luminos (light), Kinesis (motion)
Each god has: origin story (which dissolved civilization created them), dormant location, discovery quest trigger
Each god has 4 recall options based on emotion type (joy/fury/sorrow/awe)
Each recall option specifies: god's new name, new domain, passive world effect, player buff, NPC behavior change, new side quests unlocked
Total: 16 distinct recall outcomes documented
Recall is permanent — document why and how this creates replay value
Cross-references docs/world/factions.md (Dormant Pantheon section)
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: PARALLEL with US-001, US-002. Read docs/world/factions.md for the Dormant Pantheon concept. Each god = one Act II set piece.

userStories.title: Author Act I scene-by-scene script
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need a complete scene-by-scene script for Act I so dialogue writers and event programmers know exactly what happens.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/story/act1-script.md created
10-15 scenes covering: player arrival, meeting Lira, learning memory operations, first combat, village exploration, NPC relationships, first Stagnation Zone discovery, Lira getting frozen
Each scene has: location, involved characters, trigger condition, dialogue (full text), player actions, rewards/consequences
Tutorial integration: which scenes teach which mechanics (collect, remix, broadcast, combat)
Emotional arc clear: wonder → learning → growing confidence → shock (Lira frozen)
Cross-references docs/story/structure.md Act I section
Cross-references docs/story/characters.md for character voice consistency
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: SEQUENTIAL — depends on US-001 (geography for locations). Read docs/story/structure.md and docs/story/characters.md first.

userStories.title: Author Act II scene-by-scene script

acceptanceCriteria: docs/story/act2-script.md created
15-20 scenes covering: Frontier exploration, 4 dormant god recall sequences, Preserver confrontations, moral dilemma scenes, Curator's endgame reveal

At least 2 scenes where preservation is the right call (moral complexity)
Frontier settlements with unique NPCs and memory-sharing quests
Emotional arc: confidence → moral questioning → determination
Cross-references docs/world/dormant-gods.md (US-003) for recall options
Cross-references docs/story/structure.md Act II section
No TBD markers remain

userStories.title: Author Act III scene-by-scene script
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need a complete Act III script covering the climax, final dungeon, and ending.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/story/act3-script.md created
10-15 scenes covering: The Sketch traversal, The Depths exploration, Preserver fortress, First Memory confrontation, ending sequence
The Sketch scenes specify abstract/unfinished landscape challenges the player must 'remember into solidity'
Final dungeon (Preserver fortress) is a crystalline museum with specific rooms and puzzles
First Memory scene: player remixes it (not destroy vs preserve), world leaps forward
Ending: world blooms, NPCs evolve, gods fully awaken, Preservers become archivists
Emotional arc: awe → challenge → triumph → wonder (ending)
Cross-references docs/story/structure.md Act III section
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: SEQUENTIAL — depends on US-005. Keep the hopeful tone — this is NOT grimdark.

userStories.title: Author complete NPC dialogue bank

acceptanceCriteria: docs/story/dialogue-bank.md created

Dialogue organized by: character → trigger condition → lines
Trigger conditions match scene scripts (Act I/II/III)
Procedural NPC dialogue templates: 10+ greeting variants, 10+ personality lines, 10+ quest hooks
Shop NPC dialogue: browse, buy, sell, insufficient gold, farewell
Dormant god dialogue: per recall form (4 gods × 4 forms = 16 sets)
Voice consistency verified: each character sounds distinct
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: PARALLEL with US-006. Can be written alongside Act III since it pulls from all acts. Read docs/story/characters.md for voice.

userStories.title: Author complete quest chains document

Side quests: 10+ optional quests tied to memory broadcasting, NPC relationships, and exploration

No TBD markers remain

userStories.title: Author class progression document with stat tables
userStories.description: As a game designer, I need exact XP curves, stat growth tables, and skill unlock schedules for all four classes.
acceptanceCriteria: docs/design/progression.md created

Stat growth per level per class: HP, SP, STR, INT, DEF, AGI as exact numbers (not ranges)
Skill unlock schedule: which skills unlock at which levels for each class (4 classes × 6-8 skills each)
Memory-based progression: how memory broadcasting affects class power (per docs/design/classes.md)
Subclass unlock conditions (Act II, tied to god recall)
Level cap and endgame stat targets documented
Balanced: no class is obviously dominant in all situations
No TBD markers remain
userStories.notes: PARALLEL with US-001-003. Read docs/design/classes.md and docs/design/combat.md for context. Systems section — independent of story.

userStories.title: Author complete enemies catalog

acceptanceCriteria: docs/design/enemies-catalog.md created
